thread.title: Maplin enters administration putting 2,500 jobs at risk across UK

author: Jonathon Manning
title: Maplin enters administration putting 2,500 jobs at risk across UK
text:
Business Maplin enters administration putting 2,500 jobs at risk across UK The electronics retailer failed to find a buyer to secure its future, and said it had suffered because of the Brexit hit pound Share A Maplin store (Image: Loughborough Echo) Share Get business   Could   
Electrical retailer Maplin has entered administration putting 2,500 jobs at risk across the UK. 
The high street chain had been searching for a buyer in an effort to save the struggling business. 
However, Maplin’s senior management team was unable to find a suitable buyer and said the capital needed to prop up the business - and shield against the tough trading conditions on the high street - had proved “impossible to raise”. 
The company has four stores in the North East in Newcastle, Gateshead , Cramlington and Durham. 
Chief executive Graham Harris said: “I can confirm this morning that it has not been possible to secure a solvent sale of the business and as a result we now have no alternative but to enter into an administration process. 
“During this process Maplin will continue to trade and remains open for business. 
“The business has worked hard over recent months to mitigate a combination of impacts from sterling devaluation post Brexit, a weak consumer environment and the withdrawal of credit insurance. 
“This necessitated an intensive search for new capital that in current market conditions has proved impossible to raise. 
“These macro factors have been the principal challenge not the Maplin brand or its market differentiation. 
“We believe passionately that Maplin has a place on the high street, and that our trust, credibility and expertise meets a customer need that is not supported elsewhere.” Read More Toys R Us goes into administration, putting 3,000 jobs at risk 
The 40-year-old firm said it had been hit by the impact of the Brexit-hit pound, a “weak consumer environment” and the withdrawal of credit insurance. 
The news comes shortly after it was revealed that Toys R Us has also entered administration putting 3,000 jobs at risk. Like us on Facebook
